com.iota.iri.utils.dag

Class DAGHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iota.iri.utils.dag.DAGHelper

  • public class DAGHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class offers generic functions for recurring tasks that are related to the tangle and that otherwise would have to be implemented over and over again in different parts of the code.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static java.util.HashMap<Tangle,DAGHelper> instances
      Holds references to the singleton DAGHelper instances.
      protected Tangle tangle
      Holds a reference to the tangle instance which acts as an interface to the used database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected DAGHelper(Tangle tangle)
      Constructor of the class which allows to provide the required dependencies for the implemented methods.

      • instances

        protected Tangle tangle

    • Constructor Detail

      • DAGHelper

        protected DAGHelper(Tangle tangle)
        Constructor of the class which allows to provide the required dependencies for the implemented methods. Since the constructor is protected we are not able to manually create instances of this class and have to retrieve them through their singleton accessor get(com.iota.iri.storage.Tangle).
        Parameters:
        tangle - database interface used to retrieve data

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static DAGHelper get(Tangle tangle)
        This method allows us to retrieve the DAGHelper instance that corresponds to the given parameters. To save memory and to be able to use things like caches effectively, we do not allow to create multiple instances of this class for the same set of parameters, but create a singleton instance of it.
        Parameters:
        tangle - database interface used to retrieve data
        Returns:
        DAGHelper instance that allows to use the implemented methods.

      • traverseApprovers

        public void traverseApprovers(Hash startingTransactionHash,
                              java.util.function.Predicate<TransactionViewModel> condition,
                              java.util.function.Consumer<TransactionViewModel> currentTransactionConsumer,
                              java.util.Set<Hash> processedTransactions)
                       throws TraversalException
        This method provides a generic interface for traversing all approvers of a transaction up to a given point. To make the use of this method as easy as possible we provide a broad range of possible parameter signatures, so we do not have to manually convert between milestones, transactions and hashes (see other methods with the same name). It uses an non-recursive iterative algorithm that is able to handle huge chunks of the tangle without running out of memory. It creates a queue of transactions that are being examined and processes them one by one. As new approvers are found, they will be added to the queue and processed accordingly. Every found transaction is passed into the provided condition lambda, to determine if it still belongs to the desired set of transactions and only then will be passed on to the currentTransactionConsumer lambda.
        Parameters:
        startingTransactionHash - the starting point of the traversal
        condition - predicate that allows to control how long the traversal should continue (receives the current transaction as a parameter)
        currentTransactionConsumer - a lambda function that allows us to "process" the found transactions
        processedTransactions - a set of hashes that shall be considered as "processed" already and that will consequently be ignored in the traversal
        Throws:
        TraversalException - if anything goes wrong while traversing the graph and processing the transactions

      • traverseApprovers

        public void traverseApprovers(Hash startingTransactionHash,
                              java.util.function.Predicate<TransactionViewModel> condition,
                              java.util.function.Consumer<TransactionViewModel> currentTransactionConsumer)
                       throws TraversalException
        Works like traverseApprovers(Hash, Predicate, Consumer, Set) but defaults to an empty set of processed transactions to consider all transactions.
        Parameters:
        startingTransactionHash - the starting point of the traversal
        condition - predicate that allows to control how long the traversal should continue (receives the current transaction as a parameter)
        currentTransactionConsumer - a lambda function that allows us to "process" the found transactions
        Throws:
        TraversalException - if anything goes wrong while traversing the graph and processing the transactions
        See Also:
        traverseApprovers(Hash, Predicate, Consumer, Set)

      • traverseApprovees

        public void traverseApprovees(Hash startingTransactionHash,
                              java.util.function.Predicate<TransactionViewModel> condition,
                              java.util.function.Consumer<TransactionViewModel> currentTransactionConsumer,
                              java.util.Set<Hash> processedTransactions)
                       throws TraversalException
        This method provides a generic interface for traversing all approvees of a transaction down to a given point. To make the use of this method as easy as possible we provide a broad range of possible parameter signatures, so we do not have to manually convert between milestones, transactions and hashes (see other methods with the same name). It uses an non-recursive iterative algorithm that is able to handle huge chunks of the tangle without running out of memory. It creates a queue of transactions that are being examined and processes them one by one. As new approvees are found, they will be added to the queue and processed accordingly. Every found transaction is passed into the provided condition lambda, to determine if it still belongs to the desired set of transactions and only then will be passed on to the currentTransactionConsumer lambda.
        Parameters:
        startingTransactionHash - the starting point of the traversal
        condition - predicate that allows to control how long the traversal should continue (receives the current transaction as a parameter)
        currentTransactionConsumer - a lambda function that allows us to "process" the found transactions
        processedTransactions - a set of hashes that shall be considered as "processed" already and that will consequently be ignored in the traversal
        Throws:
        TraversalException - if anything goes wrong while traversing the graph and processing the transactions

      • traverseApprovees

        public void traverseApprovees(Hash startingTransactionHash,
                              java.util.function.Predicate<TransactionViewModel> condition,
                              java.util.function.Consumer<TransactionViewModel> currentTransactionConsumer)
                       throws TraversalException
        Works like traverseApprovees(Hash, Predicate, Consumer, Set) but defaults to an empty set of processed transactions to consider all transactions.
        Parameters:
        startingTransactionHash - the starting point of the traversal
        condition - predicate that allows to control how long the traversal should continue (receives the current transaction as a parameter)
        currentTransactionConsumer - a lambda function that allows us to "process" the found transactions
        Throws:
        TraversalException - if anything goes wrong while traversing the graph and processing the transactions
        See Also:
        traverseApprovees(Hash, Predicate, Consumer, Set)
